metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46874 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A file with a long filename could have had its filename truncated to removethe valid extension, leaving a malicious extension in its place. This couldpotentially led to user confusion and the execution of maliciouscode.
*Note*: This issue was originally included in the advisories forThunderbird 102.6, but a patch (specific to Thunderbird) was omitted,resulting in it actually being fixed in Thunderbird 102.6.1. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 108, Thunderbird < 102.6.1, Thunderbird <102.6, and Firefox ESR < 102.6. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46874` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
